question: 落ちる
sourceAnswer: to: {fall-down/drop/fall-(e.g.-rain)/sink-(e.g.-sun-or-moon)/fall-onto-(e.g.-light-or-one's-gaze)/be-used-in-a-certain-place-(e.g.-money)} | be-{omitted/missing} | {decrease/sink} | {fail-(e.g.-exam-or-class)/lose-(contest,-election,-etc.)} | {crash/degenerate/degrade/fall-behind} | become-indecent-(of-a-conversation) | {be-ruined/go-under} | {fade/come-out-(e.g.-a-stain)/come-off-(e.g.-makeup)/be-removed-(e.g.-illness,-possessing-spirit,-name-on-a-list)} | {fall-(into-someone's-hands)/become-someone's-possession} | {fall-(into-a-trap)/fall-(for-a-trick)} | {give-in/give-up/confess/flee} | {fall/be-defeated/surrender} | {come-to-(in-the-end)/end-in} | fall-(in-love,-asleep,-etc.) | swoon-(judo) | {consent/understand} | {go-down-(of-a-website,-server,-etc.)/crash} | {log-out-(of-an-online-game,-chat-room,-etc.)/drop-out/leave/go-offline} | die | move-to-the-depths | go-down-(of-a-website,-server,-etc.)
userAnswer: to: fall/drop | drop-lower | fall-into-one's-hands | be-inferior-to | come-off | fail
activeAnswer: to: fall/drop | drop-lower | fall-into-one's-hands | be-inferior-to | come-off | fail
sourceMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>fall</kanji> and the vocab verb version means <vocabulary>to fall down</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>to fall</vocabulary>, and <vocabulary>to drop</vocabulary>. It can also mean <vocabulary>to fail</vocabulary>, in the sense of failing an exam.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

If you start <vocabulary>to fall down</vocabulary>, what do you yell? "OHHHH (<ja>お</ja>)!"
